offerings. Stephen Elop , a defector from Redmond, and Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer jointly released a statement on the rebel alliance against the growing Android presence in the smart phone market. The statement read: Nokia will adopt Windows Phone as its primary smartphone strategy, innovating on top of the platform in areas such as imaging, where Nokia is a market leader. Stephen Elop implied, in a separate interview, that together Microsoft and Nokia would be able to level the playing field with the exponentially growing Android contingent, as well as high-end smart phone leaders Apple.

Providing Vermont and other states with the flexibility to build upon health care reform will result in better care and greater access at a lower cost. Allowing us to become a laboratory for innovation and excellence will help Vermonters, while once again allowing us to lead the way.
